q: The eye with which I see God is the same eye with which God sees me.
h:
“The eye with which I see God is the same eye with which God sees me.” —
Meister Eckhart

q: The more you trust yourself, the less you compare yourself to others.
h:
“The more you trust yourself, the less you compare yourself to others.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: The greatest work that kindness does to others is that it makes them kind themselves.
h:
“The greatest work that kindness does to others is that it makes them kind themselves.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it.
h:
“Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it. ” —
Charles Swindoll

q: The greatest treasures are those invisible to the eye but found by the heart.
h:
“The greatest treasures are those invisible to the eye but found by the heart.” —
Judy Garland

q: Concentrated power has always been the enemy of liberty.
h:
“Concentrated power has always been the enemy of liberty.” —
Ronald Reagan

q: Showing off is the fool's idea of glory.
h:
“Showing off is the fool's idea of glory. ” —
Bruce Lee

q: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
h:
“Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life. ” —
Confucius

q: Exceptional thinkers ignore their critics and go about their business making history.
h:
“Exceptional thinkers ignore their critics and go about their business making history.” —
John Eliot

q: Anyone who dreams of an uncommon life eventually discovers there is no choice but to seek an uncommon approach to living it.
h:
“Anyone who dreams of an uncommon life eventually discovers there is no choice but to seek an uncommon approach to living it.” —
Gary Keller

q: No amount of regretting can change the past, and no amount of worrying can change the future.
h:
“No amount of regretting can change the past, and no amount of worrying can change the future.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Everybody needs a passion. That's what keeps life interesting.
h:
“Everybody needs a passion. That's what keeps life interesting.” —
Betty White

q: The less people know, the more stubbornly they know it.
h:
“The less people know, the more stubbornly they know it.” —
Osho

q: Be strong. Be confident. Be the star of your own life.
h:
“Be strong. Be confident. Be the star of your own life.” —
Estee Lauder

q: Here is the test to find whether your mission on earth is finished. If you're alive, it isn't.
h:
“Here is the test to find whether your mission on earth is finished. If you're alive, it isn't.” —
Richard Bach

q: Life and the simple beauty of it is too good to pass up.
h:
“Life and the simple beauty of it is too good to pass up.” —
Christopher McCandless

q: One is never afraid of the unknown; one is afraid of the known coming to an end.
h:
“One is never afraid of the unknown; one is afraid of the known coming to an end.” —
Jiddu Krishnamurti

q: Fashion fades, only style remains the same.
h:
“Fashion fades, only style remains the same.” —
Coco Chanel

q: Choose to be optimistic, it feels better.
h:
“Choose to be optimistic, it feels better.” —
Dalai Lama

q: A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
h:
“A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.” —
Lao Tzu

q: The quality of your life is determined by the quality of questions you ask.
h:
“The quality of your life is determined by the quality of questions you ask.” —
Tony Robbins

q: There is no right or wrong, only a series of possibilities that shift with each thought, feeling, and action that you experience.
h:
“There is no right or wrong, only a series of possibilities that shift with each thought, feeling, and action that you experience.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: You can only lose something that you have, but you cannot lose something that you are.
h:
“You can only lose something that you have, but you cannot lose something that you are.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: Today is the oldest you've ever been, and the youngest you'll ever be again.
h:
“Today is the oldest you've ever been, and the youngest you'll ever be again.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Nothing good ever comes of violence.
h:
“Nothing good ever comes of violence.” —
Martin Luther

q: Well done is better than well said.
h:
“Well done is better than well said.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: Silence is a source of great strength.
h:
“Silence is a source of great strength.” —
Lao Tzu

q: You become stronger with every problem you face and every obstacle you overcome.
h:
“You become stronger with every problem you face and every obstacle you overcome.” —
Celestine Chua

q: If you're walking down the right path and you're willing to keep walking, eventually you'll make progress.
h:
“If you're walking down the right path and you're willing to keep walking, eventually you'll make progress.” —
Barack Obama

q: Even if you stumble and fall down, it doesn't mean you've chosen the wrong path.
h:
“Even if you stumble and fall down, it doesn't mean you've chosen the wrong path.” —
Zen Proverb

q: However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at.
h:
“However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at.” —
Stephen Hawking

q: Do what you feel in your heart to be right - for you'll be criticized anyway.
h:
“Do what you feel in your heart to be right - for you'll be criticized anyway.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Wheels of justice grind slow but grind fine.
h:
“Wheels of justice grind slow but grind fine.” —
Sun Tzu

q: Don't be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.
h:
“Don't be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: The wisdom of life consists in the elimination of the nonessentials.
h:
“The wisdom of life consists in the elimination of the nonessentials.” —
Lin Yutang

q: Life is much more successfully looked at from a single window.
h:
“Life is much more successfully looked at from a single window.” —
F. Scott Fitzgerald

q: To judge a man by his weakest link or deed is like judging the power of the ocean by one wave.
h:
“To judge a man by his weakest link or deed is like judging the power of the ocean by one wave.” —
Elvis Presley

q: I want the fishing rod, not the fish.
h:
“I want the fishing rod, not the fish.” —
Yanni

q: FEAR has two meanings: 'Forget Everything And Run' or 'Face Everything And Rise.' The choice is yours.
h:
“FEAR has two meanings: 'Forget Everything And Run' or 'Face Everything And Rise.' The choice is yours.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: The secret of perfect health lies in keeping the mind always cheerful - never worried, never hurried, never borne down by any fear, thought or anxiety.
h:
“The secret of perfect health lies in keeping the mind always cheerful - never worried, never hurried, never borne down by any fear, thought or anxiety.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: Everyone wants to go to Heaven, but no one wants to die.
h:
“Everyone wants to go to Heaven, but no one wants to die.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: You are the only real obstacle in your path to a fulfilling life.
h:
“You are the only real obstacle in your path to a fulfilling life.” —
Les Brown

q: I believe that one of life's greatest risks is never daring to risk.
h:
“I believe that one of life's greatest risks is never daring to risk.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Progress comes to those who train and train; reliance on secret techniques will get you nowhere.
h:
“Progress comes to those who train and train; reliance on secret techniques will get you nowhere.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: Be a master of change rather than a victim of change.
h:
“Be a master of change rather than a victim of change.” —
Brian Tracy

q: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
h:
“In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.” —
Robert Frost

q: Let us rather run the risk of wearing out than rusting out.
h:
“Let us rather run the risk of wearing out than rusting out.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: There are no second chances in life, except to feel remorse.
h:
“There are no second chances in life, except to feel remorse.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape a hundred days of sorrow.
h:
“If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape a hundred days of sorrow. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: Never confuse a single defeat with a final defeat.
h:
“Never confuse a single defeat with a final defeat.” —
F. Scott Fitzgerald
